item.title: RISSQ Packages
item.description: Common infrastructure Common structures, classes Data sets Shiny App Input/Output interfaces: file import, export, etc. Statistical methods Statistical Process Control: Control Charts, Capability Analysis Measurement Systems Analysis: Type I, Crossed, Nested, Unbalanced Acceptance Sampling

item.title: RISSQ Project
item.description: The Problem Industry and Business need Statistics for their survival and development. Being this an axiom difficult to contradict, and having the statistical software R had an impressive increase of use1, it would be expected that statistical methods for quality control and improvement had had a similar evolution. However, even though some companies are starting to use R for those methods, there is a long way to attain the usage and confidence standard commercial tools have reached2.

item.title: About
item.description: This is the website for the RISSQ project (R Infrastructure for Statistical Standards on Quality). The project was started by the author of the SixSigma R package author, Emilio L. Cano1. Check the updated list of supporters and contributors. Emilio L. Cano, Statistician. Associate Professor at the Faculty of Law and Social Sciences of the University of Castilla-la Mancha (UCLM), as well as research scientist at the Institute for Regional Development (IDR) of the UCLM.
